channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: « Aucune action requise » : DJI tente d’éteindre l’incendie après le scandale Romo
item.description: Après la tempête médiatique déclenchée par la découverte d'une faille béante dans l'application DJI Home, la marque chinoise sort enfin du bois.

item.title: Cisco warns of critical SD-WAN security flaw which has been open since 2023
item.description: Maximum-severity Cisco flaw is being actively abused, and FCEB agencies were given just a few days to patch.

item.title: Apple dévoile son système de vérification d’âge sur iOS 26.4
item.description: La dernière bêta d’iOS 26.4 voit apparaître un système de vérification d’âge. Pensé pour prendre les devants sur les nouvelles législations en matière de protection des mineurs, ce système est pour le moment exclusif au Royaume-Uni.

item.title: How to avoid bad hires in early-stage startups
item.description: Lucena got the idea for Mappa after trying to build a marketing team but continually feeling like she had made the wrong hires.

item.title: Everything Samsung revealed at its Galaxy Unpacked event
item.description: Samsung's new privacy screen feature on Galaxy S26 Ultra was the most notable feature of the event.

item.title: Yes, the Filmmakers Behind ‘Spider-Man: Beyond the Spider-Verse’ Feel the Pressure
item.description: Producers Phil Lord and Chris Miller spoke to io9 about the highly anticipated Spidey sequel, out in 2027.

item.title: Burger King will use AI to check if employees say ‘please’ and ‘thank you’
item.description: Burger King is launching an AI chatbot that will live in the headsets used by employees. The voice-enabled chatbot, called "Patty," is part of an overarching BK Assistant platform that will not only assist employees with meal preparation but also evaluate their interactions with customers for "friendliness." Thibault Roux, Burger King's chief digital officer, tells […]...

item.title: The smart lock standard that could replace your keys is finally here
item.description: Aliro has officially arrived. The smart lock standard, first announced in 2023, finally has a 1.0 spec, meaning companies can now get hardware certified and roll out support. Aliro is an open standard designed to let any smart lock be unlocked by any smartphone, regardless of manufacturer. It stores a digital key in your phone's […]

item.title: The best budget cameras for 2026
item.description: Like other electronics products, cameras have shot up in price in the US of late due to tariffs and other reasons. Fortunately, there are still many models available for less than the price of a budget smartphone ($750 or less) that offer great features for creators and photographers alike. If it’s speed you want for sports or action shots of your kids, models like Canon’s R50 can shoot bursts as fast as many high-end cameras. Creators, meanwhile, can choose Sony’s ZV-E10 for vlogging jobs. There are also great, and cheap, models in the action and gimbal camera categories. Which one to pick th...

item.title: Pourquoi ce laptop gaming 16″ avec RTX 5060 et 1 To de SSD, affiché 500 € de moins, est une excellente affaire ?
item.description: Le Gigabyte A16 3VH est un PC portable qui mêle puissance, immersion et autonomie pour 1 099,99 euros grâce à cette réduction de 31 % du côté de la Fnac.

item.title: How to watch Apple TV from anywhere
item.description: Home to Ted Lasso, Slow Horses, the MLS and MLB and, in the US, F1, here's how to watch Apple TV from anywhere with a VPN.

item.title: Assassin's Creed 3 director discusses the disastrous launch of Skull and Bones, says the 'junior' devs didn't have enough experience and were 'trying to essentially make Black Flag crossed with World of Tanks or World of Warships'
item.description: Alex Hutchinson, creative director of Assassin's Creed 3 and Far Cry 4, has discussed what went wrong with the launch of Skull and Bones, suggesting it was down to a lack of experience from the development team.

item.title: Best Tested Ski Clothes (2026): Shells, Jackets, Wool Socks
item.description: From weatherproof jackets and pants to puffers, gloves, and socks, WIRED’s winter sports experts have got you covered.

item.title: Apple’s rumored $699 MacBook sounds like a 2017 MacBook Air with an iPhone chip, according to new code leaks
item.description: A new leak suggests Apple’s rumored affordable MacBook might feel very similar to the 2017 MacBook Air, on paper at least.

item.title: NY AG: Valve's loot boxes can get kids hooked on gambling
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James has accused Valve of promoting illegal gambling through its video games in a lawsuit filed by her office. According to the AG’s announcement, her office conducted an investigation and had concluded that Valve enabled gambling by enticing users to pay for a chance at rare items from loot boxes in Counter-Strike 2, Team Fortress 2 and Dota 2. In the lawsuit, the New York AG stressed that Valve’s loot boxes are “particularly pernicious,” because the games are popular among children and teenagers. The lawsuit described the loot box model, which requires a pl...

item.title: Spotify and Liquid Death have revealed the world’s first music-streaming urn — and now you can play your departed grandma the pop bangers she’s missing out on
item.description: Spotify has partnered with Liquid Death for the first Bluetooth speaker urn, and it's the whackiest device I've seen this year so far.

item.title: 'Modern games are pushing GPU architectures harder than ever': Micron reveals faster new video RAM that could power Nvidia RTX 6000 GPUs
item.description: 'Rising size of game assets and AI models has outpaced GPU memory capacity, until now': Micron reveals faster new video RAM.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says conflict between Pentagon and Anthropic is ‘not the end of the world’
item.description: Anthropic has been given until Friday to allow the Pentagon to use its Claude model for "all lawful purposes," or risk losing its $200 million DoD contract.

item.title: CP+ 2026 live: we're at the world’s biggest photography show, with the latest news from Canon, Sigma and more
item.description: We're visiting CP+ 2026 in Japan – the world's biggest photography show – checking out the latest camera gear from Canon, Sony, Sigma and more

item.title: The New ‘Lego Batman’ Game Gets the Party Started With Prince’s Legendary ‘Batman’ Soundtrack
item.description: The Joker rampages though Gotham City's art museum like it's 1989 again in this fun cinematic clip featuring 'Partyman.'

item.title: 5 Medical Innovations on HBO’s ‘The Pitt’ That Are Revolutionizing Emergency Care
item.description: The hit medical drama often showcases cutting edge—and sometimes controversial—technologies that are changing the way doctors save lives.

item.title: Who’s Your Daddy? A Chatbot
item.description: More people are turning to AI to explore their BDSM fantasies, but some in the community feel it’s a cop-out.

item.title: Instagram will alert parents if their kids ‘repeatedly’ search for self-harm topics
item.description: Starting next week, Instagram will notify parents to check on their teen searching for terms related to self-harm or suicide. Meta says a similar alert system for its AI chatbots is coming later this year. The new Instagram feature sends parents an alert when their child "repeatedly tries to search for terms clearly associated with […]

item.title: Instagram now alerts parents if their teen searches for suicide or self-harm content
item.description: Parents will be informed if their teen searches for suicide or self-harm content and offered resources.

item.title: Instagram will alert parents if teens repeatedly search for suicide or self-harm content
item.description: Instagram is adding a new alert for the parents of teen users of its social media platform. The network will alert the adult if their child repeatedly searches for terms about suicide or self-harm in a short time frame. From that notification, the parent will optionally be able to access resources for having conversations with their teen about these topics. These alerts will begin rolling out for parental supervision users in the US, UK, Australia and Canada next week, with later regions to be added in the future."We chose a threshold that requires a few searches within a short period of time,...

item.title: Axe just made it way harder to overuse its body spray
item.description: Subtle design changes will have middle school teachers everywhere breathing a sigh of relief. There are a few odors from adolescence that are seared into the brains of most Americans who grew up after the 1980s: the aroma of freshly baked brick pizza in the school cafeteria, the acrid stink of a locker room, and the unmistakable scent of teen boys wearing an unforgivable amount of Axe body spray. ...

item.title: How AI evolved from quest for a mathematical theory of the mind
item.description: The progress in AI over the past decade is beginning to suggest answers to some of our deepest questions about human intelligence. Below, Tom Griffiths shares five key insights from his new book, The Laws of Thought: The Quest for a Mathematical Theory of the Mind.

item.title: Try these simple email tricks to get faster replies
item.description: Well-written emails make you sound smarter, reduce misunderstandings, and speed up responses. Your colleagues decide in less than a minute whether your email is worth replying to. Microsoft’s 2025 Work Trend Index Report shows that the average employee receives 117 emails a day, and most are skimmed in under 60 seconds. In other words, if your email takes someone more than a minute to understand, there’s a strong chance you won’t be getting a timely response....

item.title: Pokémon TCG Journey Together 3-Pack Blisters are now only $24 at Walmart — save vs. Amazon
item.description: Pokémon TCG: Journey Together 3-Pack Blisters are down to $23.95 at Walmart, undercutting Amazon and nearing market price.

item.title: Google releases Gemini Enterprise mobile apps to bring AI to all your key work tasks
item.description: Google has launched a new Gemini Enterprise app for on-the-go access to the agentic AI platform it announced in October.

item.title: Nothing teases Headphone (a) ahead of launch next week
item.description: The Headphone (a) will be the brand's first over-ear headphone.

item.title: Seth Meyers takes A Closer Look at Trumps State of the Union tantrum
item.description: Seth Meyers used his "A Closer Look" segment to summarise Donald Trump's State of the Union speech.

item.title: De'Longhi just upgraded one of my favorite coffee makers with 'Silent Technology' to make mornings 65% quieter
item.description: The new De'Longhi Eletta Ultra can make 50 hot and cold drinks, split into 'curated' menus to help you find something you'll enjoy.

item.title: The Best Headphones I’ve Tried (and Why I'd Buy Them All)
item.description: The portable listening revolution is fully underway. From open earbuds to noise cancelers and wired headphones, I can find a reason to love them all.

item.title: How meekness was once considered a virtue—and how it could help us today
item.description: Meekness once meant not becoming weak, but subjugating power to reason—not letting anger take control. What do you envision when you think of meekness?

item.title: Coach’s new bag charms are literal books
item.description: Bold colors and distinctive designs: Here’s how Coach and Penguin designed their coveted, teeny-tiny books. The devil might’ve worn Prada in 2006, but two decades later, the fashion elite are wearing books. Case in point: Coach’s hot new accessory is a keychain made out of literal hardcovers.

item.title: Amazon pulls the plug on ambitious racing game project from former Forza Horizon devs, but stresses the 'flexibility' to find a more suitable publisher
item.description: Amazon ends partnership with ex-Forza Horizon devs Maverick Games — but thankfully, its open-world driving project hasn't been canceled yet.

item.title: Oubliez le Galaxy S26, le vrai séisme de l’Unpacked s’appelle AppFunctions
item.description: Vous avez vu les nouveaux Galaxy S26 ? Ils sont beaux, puissants, mais ce n'est pas le plus important. La vraie claque de cet Unpacked, c'est l'arrivée des AppFunctions. Une brique technique qui transforme votre smartphone en véritable agent autonome capable de piloter vos apps tout seul.

item.title: Quels sont les meilleurs gestionnaires de mots de passe en 2026 ?
item.description: Créer un mot de passe complexe est la meilleure méthode pour sécuriser ses accès, encore faut-il s'en souvenir sans avoir à le noter quelque part. Les gestionnaires de mots de passe s'en occupent à votre place : autant générer des identifiants complexes que de s'en souvenir. Voici ceux que nous vous recommandons.

item.title: Le nouveau Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra (512 Go) coûte déjà 389 € de moins, autant en profiter avant la hausse des prix
item.description: Ça y est, la gamme Samsung Galaxy S26 a été lancée par le géant sud-coréen. Aujourd'hui, c'est le modèle Ultra qui nous intéresse tout particulièrement : sur le site officiel, on peut d'ores et déjà trouver sa version 512 Go affichée à 1 272,10 euros au lieu de 1 669 euros.

item.title: How to turn your home office into a Resident Evil Safe Room in time for Requiem
item.description: Work doesn't always need to be a world of survival horror.

item.title: Want a better-sounding phone, not a new phone? It'll only cost you $60 with this little dongle
item.description: Only want to spend a little to get seriously improved audio from your phone? This could be the bijou beauty you need

item.title: Test du Roborock Saros 20 et Saros 20X : une puissance élevée pour un nettoyage impeccable
item.description: Présenté au CES 2026, le Saros 20 est une évolution du Saros 10R, avec des améliorations notables sur le plan de la performance. Citons notamment une aspiration 60 % plus puissante, un lavage des serpillières à 100 ºC et un châssis amélioré. Face aux annonces de la concurrence, que vaut ce modèle qui reprend l'essentiel des fonctions de son prédécesseur ? ...

item.title: 4 ways to bridge generational gaps at work
item.description: Building harmony in a multi-generational workplace can be tricky for most managers. A few smart lessons from family-owned businesses can help you do it right. Generational conflict has become one of the most overused explanations for workplace tension, with plenty of stereotypical blame to go around: Baby Boomers resist change. Millennials lack loyalty. Gen Z is lazy....
